bzh.plealog.hge.api.query

Interface HGEQuery


  • public interface HGEQuery
    Define a query. Such an query is defines as an hyper-graph which is used to locate sub-graph within a data graph.
    Author:
    Patrick G. Durand

    • Method Detail

      • setQuery

        void setQuery(java.lang.String query)
        Setup a new query given a query string.

      • compile

        Prepare the query.
        Parameters:

        a string representation of the query

      • setReturnDistinct

        void setReturnDistinct(boolean distinct)
        Figure out whether or not the query system will have to return distinct result.
        Parameters:
        distinct - use true to request the system to return distinct result

      • execute

        java.util.Set<HGEResult> execute(DataGraphModel model,
                               HDataGraph graph)
        Execute the query a data graph.
        Parameters:
        model - the data graph model
        graph - the data graph
        Returns:
        the results

      • addQueryListener

        void addQueryListener(HGEQueryListener listener)
        Add a listener to this query. A single query listener is allowed per query and it cannot be removed. Simply call this method with null value if you want to disable the call to a listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener.
